content.heading: Introduction to Node
copy: Node, also often called Node.js, is a JavaScript run-time environment built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. The Node run-time environment includes everything you need to execute a program written in JavaScript. Node allows you to run JavaScript as a standalone application without the need to use a browser.
The V8 JavaScript engine takes your JavaScript code and converts it into faster machine code. Machine code is low-level, meaning the computer can run the code without first needing to interpret it.
To install Node, go to the following link and download the version required: https://nodejs.org/en/
